directions: Clean and prepare the calf stomach by removing any impurities.
Cut the calf stomach into small pieces.
In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Add the calf stomach pieces to the boiling water and let it simmer for 2 hours.
Remove the pot from heat and let it cool down.
Strain the liquid from the pot, discarding the calf stomach pieces.
Add salt to the liquid and stir until dissolved.
Transfer the liquid into a sterilized container and let it sit at room temperature for 24 hours.
After 24 hours, the liquid will have curdled and separated into whey and curds.
Strain the liquid again to separate the whey from the curds.
The strained liquid is now rennet and can be used in cheese-making recipes.
